item.title: Using Google Maps in an Ionic application
item.description: Some introductory words go here An inline code snippet goes here. and a link: GitHub As Grace Hopper said: I’ve always been more interested Heading 1 Heading 2 Heading 3 Heading 4 Some HTML <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <title>huhu</title> </head> <body> <h1>hello</h1> </body> </html> Animated gif of result UI goes here Prerequisites Basic understanding of Ionic 2 Ionic installed on your machine If not, read… Let’s get started Now, let’s start.

item.title: Using Google Maps in an Ionic application 2
item.description: Some introductory words go here Animated gif of result UI goes here Prerequisites Basic understanding of Ionic 2 Ionic installed on your machine If not, read… Let’s get started Now, let’s start. Create a new Ionic 2 application Run ionic start ionic-google-maps to create a new Ionic 2 application. Once the application has been generated, make the newly generated directory your working directory: cd ionic-google-maps. Google Maps We are going to use the Google Maps Javascript API, not the native SDK…
